item.title: Creation
item.description: I’ve been analyzing what I like. Why I like certain things, etc. There’s the obvious ones: Video games and poker. That’s simple, because I like winning. Some others are more social or romantic, fulfilling basic human needs involving other humans. There’s one that’s odd that I haven’t quite found the answer to. And that’s art. Why do I enjoy a good movie or a book? There’s a fair argument to be made that I empathize with the characters, as in put myself into their shoes.

item.title: You Need Empathy
item.description: An interesting notion came to me. In the shower, I was musing about my lack of ideas for topics to write about. I briefly explored the possibility that I simply don’t have that many interesting thoughts. Maybe just forcing myself to write stuff out just made that obvious, but I don’t think it’s as simple as that. I can talk peoples’ ears off in real life. It’s simple; I just expect you to know everything I already do.
